title: unable to access atleast two of the accounts I use almost daily
content:
First website opens I put in my user name then click the little green "enter" box and it does nothing. will not move on to password. The second website I put in my user name and password and it replies "Oops! Something went wrong!" I also can't get the sale ads from this website. They don't seem to be able to get into my email box.

I'm really frustrated with this. This is the second time this has happened but I don't know the repair guy did to fix it the first time and at that time it only affected one of the accounts which was my credit union.

I tried taking screen shots but It won't paste into this box and I can't get a shot of accessibility properties which is where I find the errors that I don't know how to fix.
creator: KaronM

title: pull down menus/auto resizing
content: Hello, Just recently the pull down menus on all sites including this page here, do not work. If I click the arrow the menu pops up & immediately disappears. I cannot choose any of the things listed in the menu. I have to try a 1st letter or number to see if that matches any of the items on the menu. Also, every time I use the CTRL button, the screen resizes! Every copy & paste makes the screen get larger, and I have to manually size back down to normal. I have tried the Firefox refresh, and it made no difference. Is there an update I can take off, or a new one that will fix these issues? Thank you Christine
creator: a996ontrak

title: Prevent web browser opening when connection goes offline
content:
Hi

I guess this applies for any web browser, but is there an option to disable this with Firefox...? Basically, whenever my BT connection goes offline, Firefox decides to take it upon itself to open up just to tell me it can't connect/that the web is offline etc. It's seriously annoying. I know it's offline as the hub light will change from blue to green/orange etc. It's even worse if I'm doing something else, such as playing on a game, and it's interrupted by the web browser opening itself.Â :-\

Any suggestions? Thanks.
creator: DustyShinigami
